entry.string: What is it?
XarTinyMCE is a Xaraya Module based on TinyMCE, a platform independent web based Javascript HTML WYSIWYG editor released as Open Source under LGPL by Moxiecode Systems AB
xarTinyMCE module integrates the TinyMCE application by

for use within your Xaraya web site. It has a number of nice features with  multiple browser support, (currently Mozilla, MSIE, FireFox, Opera) and support for XHTML 1.0 strict markup. There are powerful features for not only allowing or disallowing xhtml tags (like the Xaraya HTML module), but also what attributes, and  attribute values to allow. You can enhance xarTinyMCE further with some of the bundled plugins!

Version 1.1 introduces integration of the filebrowser directly into xartinymce allowing you to browse folders and files for uploading or linking, rename files and create directories according to the configuration file.
How to use it?
Install this module like you would any other Xaraya module. That is:
put the tinymce folder in your Xaraya modules directory
go to the Adminpanel menu -> Modules -> View All
Click on the "install" link of the tinymce module
The XarTinyMCE editor is not turned on by default. Once the tinymce module is installed it needs to be turned on. You can now do this in the XarTinyMCE Module Configuration area or:
go to the Adminpanels menu -> Base -> Modify Config
choose the tab "Other"
on the wysiwyg editor dropdown choose "tinymce" as the default editor

Once installed and set as the default editor, XarTinyMCE module is automatically enabled for WYSIWYG. However, you have two basic ways (with variations on these) to customize which templates are used for WYSIWYG areas:

Choose the All Text Areas Mode and every textarea will be WYSIWYG enabled. Best used with a Prompt for WYSIWYG usage. Alternatively turn off WYSIWYG in a specific textarea by adding the special reserved class class="mceNoEditor" to the textarea. This acts as a marker that tells xartinymce NOT to activate WYSIWYG for this textarea.

Choose the Mode of Special Labelled Only in the configuration options. Then add a xarTinyMCE GUI Dynamic Data Property field to your Article pubtypes or xarPages Page Type, or anywhere else you need a WYSIWYG input area. This DD Property automatically marks the div or textarea of the field with a special class trigger of class="mceEditor" and this acts as a marker for the WYSIWYG conversion. You can also do this manually by adding the class as class="mceEditor" to any textarea or div such as the textareas in xarbb templates. You can set row height and column width in the DD validation field. eg 20:80 for 20 rows high, 80 columns wide. If you can't see the xarTinyMCE GUI DD property in your DD list then
flush the Property Cache
You also have two basic ways to activate xartinymce - automatically or by using manual configuration in the templates.

Choose Automatic to have xarTinyMce automatically activated. This is required when mode is set to "All Textareas" or you are using multiple custom configurations. You do not have to add any template snippets to your Xaraya templates as the WYSIWYG areas are automatically activated with this setting.

Choose Manual Override if you wish to turn off automatic activation OR you are using a xarTinyMCE DD properties which are still automatically activated. In this instance either use a tinymce Dynamic Data Property to replace your textareas, or add the following specific template snippet code to your page or other specific templates. When you add the template snippet, all textareas contained or included in the template where you have the XarTinymce tags are converted to WYSIWYG according to the "All Text Area" or "Special Labelled Only" setting above. Alternatively, replace the variable "jstring" in an override template for the tinymce_insert.xd template with your own tinymce variables.
About the Dynamic Data Property

The xarTinyMCE Dynamic Data WYSIWYG textarea is available and works automatically with mode set to All Textareas or Special Labelled Textareas. If you are only using the TinyMCE wysiwyg properties then set your mode to Special Labelled to ensure the javascript only loads when it is needed.

Add a XarTinyMCE GUI Dynamic Data field to your publication type (or other module) in the usual way. For example, choose the TinyMCE property to replace your Textarea properties in your Article Publication types or xarPages page types. You do not add a template snippet to your template to activate it. If you can't see the xarTinyMCE GUI DD property in your DD list then
The prompt for the Wysiwyg editor is a popup dialog box, by default. From the configuration area you can set this to an On/Off button to activate the wysiwyg area.

The size of the xarTinyMCE wysiwyg field automatically takes on the size of the existing textarea. However you can adjust this in a number of ways. You can set row height and column width in the validation field. eg 20:80 for 20 rows high, 80 columns wide. You can also allow resizing of the tinyMCE wysiwyg from the config settings of the TinyMCE module, or add the FullScreen toggle plugin to your tinymce plugin and button layout.
Plug Ins

There are a number of plugins available to add on to xarTinyMCE. Add the plugin name to the Plug in list in the Modify Configuration settings. Some plugins require an extra button added in your Advanced Theme configuration, whereas others (like advimage and advlink) do not but require allowed element string added to appropriate configuration area. These include:
Emotions - click to add fancy emoticons
ISpell spell checker - only available for IE
Preview and Zoom - zoom is only available in IE
Time - click to add time in configured format
Date - click to add date in configured format
Flash - allows you to add flash files

Advanced Image - allows insert of rollover images. Add the advimg to Plugins, and img[class|style|src|border=0|alt|title|hspace|vspace|width|height|align|onmouseover|onmouseout] to the Additional Tags configuration
Advanced Link - allows insert of extended link tags, plus popup windows. Add advlink to Plugins, and a[id|name|href|style|title|onclick] to Additional Tags configuration.
Save - allows insert of a Save button. Add save to Plugins, and save to Additional Tags configuration.
Print - displays a Print function button. Add print to Plugins, and print to Additional Tags configuration.
Search and Replace - Search, Search Next and Replace function. Add searchreplace to Plugins, and search and/or replace to Additional Tags configuration.

Table - plug in to add table controls. Add table to Plugins, and either tablecontrols for all table controls, or the specific controls such as table, rowprops and so on, as per plugin documentation, to Additional Tags configuration.
Contextmenu - plug in to add context menu for tables, images and flash.
Lorem - adds text for fill in documents.
Fullscreen - toggle to edit in full screen.
Paste - text and MS Word paste plugin.
Directionality - plug in for better support of right to left languages.

Xaraya Page Break - icon click to add a Xaraya new page break to any of your publication type articles. Add xarpagebreak to Plugins, and xarpagebreak to Additional Tags configuration. Make sure you also allow images and appropriate attributes to view the pagebreak icon in your articles.
List Styles - add list style types to your lists
Layer - support for create/remove and z-index block elements
Style - Adds CSS style editing support to enable you to edit almost any CSS style property in a visual way
Spellchecker - Spellchecking for all browsers using Google and ajax, or aspell if you have it installed in php. Defaults to Google and English.
Media - Media plugin allows addition of Flash, Shockwave, Quicktime, Windows Media and Real Media.
VisualChars - Toggle to show or hide special characters such as hard spaces
Nonbreaking - Enter nonbreaking spaces
xhtmlxtras - Abiilty to add xml extras such as cite
devkit - Developer debugging options and information
Further plugins that are customized and tested for xartinymce can be downloaded from the
Xaraya website
These include the previously bundled IBrowser (image upload and browse), IManager (full featured image upload, browse and editing with all the features of phpthumbs, and Dictionary lookup plugin.

Custom Configuration now allows you to add your own custom configuration values to the existing default tinymce configuration. Make sure you check your resulting tinymce code in the displayed final configuration code on this page before using.
Included Blocks
There are no included blocks
Included Hooks
There are no included hooks
Special Notes

The text_area trigger mce_editable=[true|false] is deprecated from Version 0.9.0. Please use the trigger classes to activate or deactivate wysiwyg textareas. eg class="mceEditor" to activate a textarea, or class="mceNoEditor" to deactivate a textarea.
